childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 large eggplants (talong)
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • Cooking oil for frying
  • Optional garnish: chopped green onions or cilantro

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Place the eggplants on a baking sheet and roast them in the oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the skin is charred and the flesh is tender. Alternatively, you can grill the eggplants over an open flame until charred.

  2. Remove the eggplants from the oven or grill and let them cool. Peel off the charred skin carefully, leaving the flesh intact. Set aside.

  3. In a bowl, beat the eggs until well combined. Season with salt and pepper.

  4. Heat a small amount of oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Sauté the minced garlic and chopped onion until fragrant and the onion becomes translucent.

  5. Take one roasted eggplant and flatten it with the back of a fork or a spoon. Dip the flattened eggplant in the beaten eggs, making sure it's well coated on both sides.

  6. Heat a larger amount of oil in the same frying pan over medium heat. Place the eggplant in the pan and pour some of the beaten eggs over it to cover the surface. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the egg is cooked and golden brown.

  7. Remove the cooked Tortang Talong from the pan and drain on a paper towel to remove any excess oil. Repeat the process with the remaining eggplants and beaten eggs.

  8. Serve the Tortang Talong hot, garnished with chopped green onions or cilantro, if desired. It can be enjoyed as a main dish with steamed rice or as a side dish with other Filipino dishes.

Tortang Talong is a tasty and versatile dish that highlights the flavors of roasted eggplant and the simplicity of an omelette. It's a classic Filipino recipe that is easy to make and delicious to eat.
